p: Table 2 shows that cities with low wind speed (7.3 km/h) have also an average higher level of infected individuals than cities having higher wind speed (average of 12.77 km/h in February-March, 2020). Cities with lower intensity of wind speed have also a higher level of air pollution (average days per year), in a meteorological context of lower average temperature, less rain days, lower level of moisture % and higher average number of days of fog.
